column4: I've got a Core Duo iMac and I've installed hardy.  I got the wireless to work using b43 drivers and b43-firmware.  however, after i updated it stopped working.  according to the hardware drivers program, it is enabled but "not in use." any suggestions?
enable them
they are enabled.  i even re-enabled them.  they are still listed as "not in use"
check if they are leaded with lsmod
how do i do that?
type lsod
lsmod
what does that do?
show the kernel modules (drivers) loaded
if it is not loaded, how do i load it?
check if it's loaded first
okay, i'm going to have to switch from os x to ubuntu, be back in a sec
i don
i don't see the driver, but i do see ndiswrapper.  is that interfering with it?
the broadcom drivers did not show up in lsmod
ok, so they are genuinly not in use then, do the drivers require ndiswrapper ?
no, they are linux drivers made by the manufacturer.  i had to install a firmware driver called b43-firmware that is closed source, but the drivers themselves are free software off the ubuntu cd
did your update update the kernel
yes
kernel updates can break drivers (3rd party)
I would re-do the install process now the new kernel is running
